title: Decision to Release Trump Transcript Raises Concerns Over Future Calls
text:
WASHINGTON—President Trump’s decision to release a transcript of the phone call he had with his Ukrainian counterpart has raised concerns about its effect on future sensitive and necessarily private conversations with world leaders.

“Diplomacy is tough enough without making it public,” said Richard Haass, president of the Council on Foreign Relations, who listened into such calls while serving under President George H.W. Bush. “They’ve got to be able to do everything from float trial balloons to be critical. There are things...
